sentences.sContent: Slavery was “an unqualified evil to the negro, the white man, and the State,” said Abraham Lincoln in the 1850s.
sentences.sContent_eng: Slavery was “an unqualified evil to the negro, the white man, and the State,” said Abraham Lincoln in the 1850s.
sentences.sCn: 奴隶制，“对于黑人、白人与合众国来说都是一种彻底的邪恶，”1850年林肯如此说道。

trans.tranOther: A Negro is someone with dark skin who comes from Africa or whose ancestors came from Africa
relating to or characteristic of Negroes
